professionDescription.development: This section derives of majority anyone who's really spreading the knowledge of your front-end section of a website. So expect a lot of HTML, CSS, Javascript like tutorials.
professionDescription.design: This section derives of designers that dive into deep design concepts as well as tangible tutorials for you to complete.

node.name: Traversy Media
node.description: Traversy Media is for those who enjoy almost course like tutorials lasting to around 30-40 mins each (Very in depth).

node.name: Dev Tips
node.description: Weekly videos on the subject of development, and even personal development. Also including some tangible development tutorials, plus a hint of design.

node.name: Fun Fun Function
node.description: Now this channel goes in depth with a lot of higher level development concepts, Mattias does a great job at explaining them and I think many could use this helping hand.

node.name: Learn Code.academy
node.description: Now if you’re looking for just massive amounts of tutorials, this is your place to go. Organized playlists just waiting for you to get started.

node.name: The Net Ninja
node.description: Similar to Traversy and a few other channels, very hardworking channel owner staying on top of various topics within the industry.

node.name: FreeCodeCamp
node.description: If you don’t know about freeCodeCamp already, then you need to probably binge watch a lot of their youtube as well as check out their platform.

node.name: The Coding Train
node.description: I’m going to say this… this is probably one of the most unique development channels on youtube and honestly he offers the feeling of being in a college course.

node.name: Wes Bos
node.description: Probably one of the more famous people within the development community. Wes endlessly drops more and more content to help educate the community.

node.name: The New Boston
node.description: Hard concrete tutorials and guides for many topics.

node.name: Level Up Tuts
node.description: Another great youtuber that backs up updated tutorials with a great personality.

node.name: Design Course
node.description: I know, odd to have the name design but this is a mix between the both and It’s much more development heavy.

node.name: TheFutur
node.description: Content ranging from how to talk to clients and how to create up to date modern designs.

node.name: Flux
node.description: Great designer with a vlog covering the concepts of development and ui/ux design.

node.name: Charli Marie TV
node.description: She’s constantly delivering content such as reviewing the newest tools, sharing her workflow, and life as a freelance designer.

node.name: Jesse Showalter
node.description: His channel covers a wide range of soft skills and concrete tutorials, can’t miss out on that.

node.name: Dann Petty
node.description: Family man and a great personality, he doesn’t post as often as he used to but the interviews and the content he provides goes deep.

node.name: High Resolution Podcast
node.description: I’ve watched this time and time again, if you want to educate yourself to be more than the average designer.. This is a series you must consume.

node.name: Gal Shir
node.description: If you’re curious about one’s process for illustration, Gal is a great dude to watch.

node.name: Sketch Together
node.description: I would say, Pablo always create high quality tutorials on the newest tools.. Easily content I would watch to become current with the industry.

node.name: MDS
node.description: Another awesome family dude, with a channel loaded with soft skills.

node.name: Maex
node.description: Quite the motivational channel, with concrete tutorials alongside vlog like content.

node.name: Caler Edwards
node.description: Great pieces of content to get you started transitioning over from development to design.

node.name: Joel Beukelman
node.description: Majority vlogging content showing the behind the scenes on being a designer for Google, he also leads the design system community heavily.

node.name: The Simple Designers
node.description: Illustration tutorials galore, tons of stuff to keep you busy for some time.
